Legal_Issue: Whether the Citizenship Judge erred in assessing Mr. Ojo's residence requirement
Procedural_Context: Judicial review under sections 22.1 and 22.2 of the Citizenship Act
Evidence_Type: Physical presence records, family and community ties
Basis_of_Claim: Substantial connection to Canada despite physical presence shortfall
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Failure to address threshold question of residency
Regulation_Cited: Section 5(1)(c), sections 22.1 and 22.2 of the Citizenship Act
Application_Error: Improper application of the Koo test, failure to assess threshold residency
Review_Outcome: Decision found unreasonable, remanded to Minister
Evidence_Ignored: Threshold question of whether residency was established before relevant period
Legal_Standard: Physical presence test and substantial connection to Canada
Decision_Outcome: Citizenship application initially approved, later set aside
Cause_of_Refusal: Failure to meet residency requirement and procedural error in assessment
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient consideration of residency establishment prior to application period
Procedural_Fairness: Failure to address threshold legal question
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Strong familial and community ties used to offset physical presence shortfall
Omission_Type: Failure to address threshold question of residency
